__e: Sick people... don't spontaneously get better.
I know how much you hate being around sick people.
Sick people who are sick enough to make it to me don't spontaneously get better.
I like to come here from time to time to visit with the sickly and old.
I'm fair glad you're here to handle the physicking.
You don't know what it's like to live for ten years with a sick woman.
This little lady grows hungry. I've tried. She doesn't want me.
You're older, I understand you would do anything for him. But what can you offer to me, an old man?
But you should know that you are dealing with a very, very... sick man.
In a hospital the patients and doctors hugged each other.
So what, we relocate the entire town? What about the sick, the elderly?
Maybe it's not the best idea to get too close to a man. If he's sick and crazy.
I'm going back home to see my sick mother.
He wants to live in Paris, and I can't leave my sick mother.
Your mother's sick, your father has problems... and you jeopardise your future by showing off in class.
He sends me an obstacle. Here.
With his wife sick, he must be very busy.
Forget it! We can't give a liver to a woman this sick.
